segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes the Advanced Security Audit policy setting, Audit Other Account Management Events, which determines whether the operating system generates user account management audit events.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes the Advanced Security Audit policy setting, Audit Other Account Management Events, which determines whether the operating system generates user account management audit events.

segment.source: Audit Other Account Management Events determines whether the operating system generates user account management audit events.
segment.target: Audit Other Account Management Events determines whether the operating system generates user account management audit events.

segment.source: Event volume: Typically Low on all types of computers.
segment.target: Event volume: Typically Low on all types of computers.

segment.source: This subcategory allows you to audit next events:
segment.target: This subcategory allows you to audit next events:

segment.source: The password hash of a user account was accessed.
segment.target: The password hash of a user account was accessed.

segment.source: This happens during an Active Directory Management Tool password migration.
segment.target: This happens during an Active Directory Management Tool password migration.

segment.source: The Password Policy Checking API was called.
segment.target: The Password Policy Checking API was called.

segment.source: Password Policy Checking API allows an application to check password compliance against an application-provided account database or single account and verify that passwords meet the complexity, aging, minimum length, and history reuse requirements of a password policy.
segment.target: Password Policy Checking API allows an application to check password compliance against an application-provided account database or single account and verify that passwords meet the complexity, aging, minimum length, and history reuse requirements of a password policy.

segment.source: The only reason to enable Success auditing on domain controllers is to monitor “4782(S): The password hash an account was accessed.”
segment.target: The only reason to enable Success auditing on domain controllers is to monitor “4782(S): The password hash an account was accessed.”

segment.source: This subcategory doesn’t have Failure events, so there is no recommendation to enable Failure auditing for this subcategory.
segment.target: This subcategory doesn’t have Failure events, so there is no recommendation to enable Failure auditing for this subcategory.

segment.source: The only event which is generated on Member Servers is “4793(S): The Password Policy Checking API was called.”, this event is a typical information event with little to no security relevance.
segment.target: The only event which is generated on Member Servers is “4793(S): The Password Policy Checking API was called.”, this event is a typical information event with little to no security relevance.

segment.source: This subcategory doesn’t have Failure events, so there is no recommendation to enable Failure auditing for this subcategory.
segment.target: This subcategory doesn’t have Failure events, so there is no recommendation to enable Failure auditing for this subcategory.

segment.source: The only event which is generated on Workstations is “4793(S): The Password Policy Checking API was called.”, this event is a typical information event with little to no security relevance.
segment.target: The only event which is generated on Workstations is “4793(S): The Password Policy Checking API was called.”, this event is a typical information event with little to no security relevance.

segment.source: This subcategory doesn’t have Failure events, so there is no recommendation to enable Failure auditing for this subcategory.
segment.target: This subcategory doesn’t have Failure events, so there is no recommendation to enable Failure auditing for this subcategory.

segment.source: 4782(S): The password hash an account was accessed.
segment.target: 4782(S): The password hash an account was accessed.

segment.source: 4793(S): The Password Policy Checking API was called.
segment.target: 4793(S): The Password Policy Checking API was called.
